Description: Sandia Corporation agreed to pay $4,790,042 to resolve allegations that it violated the Byrd Amendment and the False Claims Act by using federal funds for activities related to lobbying Congress and federal agencies to obtain a renewal of its Management and Operating Contract with the Department of Energy's National Nuclear Security Administration to operate the Sandia National Laboratories.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/sandia-corporation-agrees-pay-47-million-resolve-allegations-related-lobbying-activities

Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php

The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: On July 13, 2015, the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) issued a Final Notice of Violation (SEA-2015-01) to Sandia Corporation, the management and operating contractor for NNSA's Sandia National Laboratories, for violations of the Department of Energy's classified information security program requirements relating to the unauthorized disclosure and introduction of classified information into unapproved information systems.
Info Source: http://energy.gov/sites/prod/files/2015/07/f24/Final%20Notice%20of%20Violation%20for%20Sandia%20Corporation%20%20SEA-2015-01%20%28FNOV%29%207-13-15%20%282%29.pdf

Description: On September 25, 2014, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2014-04) to Sandia Corporation, for violations of the Department of Energy's worker safety and health program (10 C.F.R. Part 851) associated with a lithium fire and explosion that occurred at Sandia National Laboratories.
Info Source: http://energy.gov/sites/prod/files/2014/10/f18/092514-Sandia-PNOV-WEA-2014-04_0.pdf

Description: On March 24, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Settlement Agreement (SSA-2011-01) to Sandia Corporation relating to an adverse trend in classified information security at the Sandia National Laboratories. The contractor accepted the terms of the Settlement Agreement.
Info Source: http://energy.gov/sites/prod/files/2013/05/f0/SSA-2011-01.pdf
